messages.subject: Re: Unschooling Quotes
messages.msgSnippet: There are lots of quotes on the Natural Child website.  They are all related to living in freedom, but some are specific to natural learning/unschooling:
messages.messageBody:
There are lots of quotes on the Natural Child website. They are all related to living in freedom, but some are specific to natural learning/unschooling: http://www.naturalchild.org/quotes/

Julie



--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Holli J <holli@...> wrote:
>
> Hello!
>
> I am one of your loyal lurkers :) I continue to learn so much by reading
> and I am always inspired!! Thanks to all of you who take the time to post
> and reply!
>
> Quick intro: My name is Holli. I have two shiny and free kiddos (5 & 3) and
> we live in Minnesota. My husband and I have always unschooled our kiddos
> and are thankful everyday to be on such a wonderful journey with our
> kids....life IS really good!
>
> The question :) I am trying to collect quotes that would pertain to
> unschooling for my mom. She would like to create something (i.e.. picture
> frames...??) that she can then engrave these types of quotes on to them. I
> thought I would ask this awesome community if you would be willing to share
> some of your favorite quotes with us?? There have been so many great quotes
> that have been posted over time....some I have written down, some I just
> remember and others I have forgot and wish I still remembered them.
>
> I thank you in advance!
>
> Holli :)
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Unschooling Quotes
messages.msgSnippet: Hello! I am one of your loyal lurkers :) I continue to learn so much by reading and I am always inspired!!  Thanks to all of you who take the time to post and
messages.messageBody:
Hello!

I am one of your loyal lurkers :) I continue to learn so much by reading
and I am always inspired!! Thanks to all of you who take the time to post
and reply!

Quick intro: My name is Holli. I have two shiny and free kiddos (5 & 3) and
we live in Minnesota. My husband and I have always unschooled our kiddos
and are thankful everyday to be on such a wonderful journey with our
kids....life IS really good!

The question :) I am trying to collect quotes that would pertain to
unschooling for my mom. She would like to create something (i.e.. picture
frames...??) that she can then engrave these types of quotes on to them. I
thought I would ask this awesome community if you would be willing to share
some of your favorite quotes with us?? There have been so many great quotes
that have been posted over time....some I have written down, some I just
remember and others I have forgot and wish I still remembered them.

I thank you in advance!

Holli :)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
